chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Alan Harrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and pay the mandatory surcharge.
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not while in the institution.
DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.
Restitution set at -0-.
Concurrent with: With 14CF4036, with 38 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms.
No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

Cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Cognitive intervention as recommended.
Mental health counseling or programming as recommended.
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

records.addlTxt: Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 01/15/2015 received and filed. (22 Pages)
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 2 years with 38 days credit - concurrent with 14cf4036 - INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 1 year; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) cognitive intevention as recommended; 5) seek and maintain employment; 6) mental health counseling or programming as recommended.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as amended in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy for Chris Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the State, Court orders the "Repeater" enhancer DISMISSED.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Br. 44, Judge Konkol will accept this case for a global resolution along with defendant's pending case.  Case set for plea on 12-15-14 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44./ds

Attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz in court, defendant Gregory Alan Harrison not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held.  Parties engaged in negotiations for global resolution.  This court has no objection to this matter being transferred to Branch 44 upon acceptance by Judge Konkol.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz in court, defendant Gregory Alan Harrison not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Defense awaiting doctor's report as to defendant's other matter.   Status date selected with the parties.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No reply from surety/defendant.
No reply from defendant.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.

Attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz in court, defendant Gregory Alan Harrison not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
*case heard without circuit court file*

Hearing proceeded.  Appearance of the defendant waived for today's hearing.  Defense reports that the defendant has new case pending with substantial cash bail.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.  The Court set bail at $1500.00 with turn over to Justice Point.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 9-11-14.  Defendant REMAINS REMANDED; hearing date selected with defense counsel.
Bench warrant filed.

Justice Point DISCHARGE SUMMARY report, received and filed.
*bench warrant outstanding*
VIOLATION Report (missed office contact), received and filed.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($50.00) ad
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison not in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared on 8-12-14 for Return on Doctor's Report.  Attorney Jeffrey Schwarz appeared on said date; defendant failed to appear.  Defendant failed to appear for his appointment with the forensic unit related to special plea (ngi).   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Justice Point report, received and filed.
dated 8-04-14 from Dr. John Pankiewicz indicating that the defendant failed to keep examination appointment, filed.
VIOLATION REPORT, received and filed.

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Megan Carmody.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  The defendant did not report for his examination.  Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 21.  Order signed and filed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea Hearing.   Defense not prepared to proceed to plea on today.  Defense enters a plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered Dr. John Pankiewicz be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI and competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16.   Filed, signed Order for Examination.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in court with Attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Jesica A Ballenger for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

 Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Nathaniel Adamson for Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
14RM021502  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04/21/14 LJ
TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and all other previously ordered conditions remain.

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in court with Attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in custody.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Return on Doctor's report.   Parties in receipt of report authored by Dr. Brook E. Lundbohm dated 4-17-14.  Dr. Lundbohm opined the defendant competent to proceed.  There being no challenge to the report from the state, defense, or defendant, the Court found that the defendant is competent to proceed.  The Court reinstates the proceedings.  Bail argument heard.  The Court ordered $50.00 cash bail with all other previously ordered conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
-Received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Notice of Discharge from Pretrial Supervision, filed.
Return on Doctor's Report set for 4-21-14 AT 8:30 A.M. TO BE HEARD IN BRANCH 21.

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in custody.  Deann Heard for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Return of Doctor's Report will be heard before Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34 for Judge Brash.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION CONTINUED.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont for Attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz in court, defendant Gregory Alan Harrison not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Hearing proceeded.  Bail argument of the parties heard.  The Court sets cash bail.  All other bail conditions continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 3-18-14
Bench warrant in file.
Filed, Justice Point Report, dated March 12, 2014
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz in court, but not in court when case called on the record.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear for 8:30 a.m. scheduled preliminary hearing.
State requests bench warrant be issued and high cash bail be set upon return of warrant.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kizzy F

Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Gregory Alan Harrison in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm for hgj
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
